Authors:
Sasitorn Jindamorakot, Pattaraporn Yukphan, Yuzo
Yamada
Title:
The phylogeny of the Lipomycetaceous yeasts: The proposal of
Kockiozyma gen. nov. for Zygozyma suomiensis
Journal: Journal of General and Applied Microbiology
Keywords:
Lipomycetaceous yeasts; Myxozyma, phylogeny; Kockiozyma
gen. nov.; Kockiozyma suomiensis comb. nov.; Zygozyma
Abstract:
The Lipomycetaceous yeasts that include teleomorphic
species of the genera Lipomyces, Dipodascopsis, and Zygozyma, and
anamorphic species of the genus Myxozyma were examined phylogenetically.
In phylogenetic trees based on 18S rRNA gene, 26S rRNA gene,
mitochondrial small subunit rRNA gene, and the EF-1α gene sequences, and
the concatenated sequences of the four regions mentioned above derived
from the neighbor-joining method, the four species of the genus Zygozyma
constituted four clusters respectively with low bootstrap values. In
phylogenetic trees based on the concatenated 18S rRNA gene, 26S rRNA
gene, mitochondrial small subunit rRNA gene, and the EF-1α gene
sequences derived from the neighbor-joining, the maximum parsimony, and
the maximum likelihood methods, Lipomyces species including Lipomyces
starkeyi, the type species of the genus Lipomyces, Lipomyces japonicus
(= Smithiozyma japonica), Lipomyces lipofer (= Waltomyces lipofer),
Babjevia anomala (= Lipomyces anomalus), and Dipodascopsis uninucleata
constituted their respective clusters. The four species of the genus
Zygozyma, viz., Zygozyma oligophaga, Zygozyma suomiensis, Zygozyma arxii
(= Kawasakia arxii), and Zygozyma smithiae were separated from one
another and phylogenetically independent from other Lipomycetaceous
yeast species. From the results obtained, all the four species were
distinguished from one another at the generic level. The name of
Kockiozyma was newly given to Zygozyma suomiensis, and Kockiozyma
suomiensis was proposed as new combination.
